result.reason: SSH file transfer passes user-entered paths with quote characters directly to SCP/SFTP upload, causing quoted filenames on the remote host
result.approach: Trim quote characters from SrcFile/DstFile in SecureTransfer constructor and Upload method, and from txtLocalFile/txtRemoteFile text values in SSHTransferWindow before passing to SecureTransfer

attempts.raw_output:
I can see the issue. In `SecureTransfer.cs`, the `DstFile` path is passed directly to SCP/SFTP upload without any quote stripping. If a user pastes a path with quotes (common from clipboard/terminal), the quotes become part of the remote filename. The `SSHTransferWindow.cs` `AllFieldsSet()` method also appends local filenames to remote paths without trimming quotes.

```json
{"decision":"implement","reason":"SSH file transfer passes user-entered paths with quote characters directly to SCP/SFTP upload, causing quoted filenames on the remote host","priority":"P2-bug","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/Tools/SecureTransfer.cs","mRemoteNG/UI/Window/SSHTransferWindow.cs"],"approach":"Trim quote characters from SrcFile/DstFile in SecureTransfer constructor and Upload method, and from txtLocalFile/txtRemoteFile text values in SSHTransferWindow before passing to SecureTransfer"}
```
